title: How to Find Someone on Instagram Without Their Username

steps.title: Open Instagram.
steps.content: Open Instagram. The Instagram app icon is a white camera on a multicolored background.

steps.title: Press the magnifying glass.
steps.content: Press the magnifying glass. This icon is on the left side of the menu at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Search
steps.content: Search for the name of the person. If you know their first and last name, try typing both for more specific results, then tap Search .

steps.title: Scroll through the results and look for the person.
steps.content: Scroll through the results and look for the person. Try sorting by the Accounts tab at the top of the screen to avoid seeing audio or tags in the results. [1] X Research source If you have mutual friends, their account should appear higher on the results page. It will likely say “Followed by (username) + (number) more” under their username and name.

steps.title: Search for related places.
steps.content: Search for related places. If you have an idea of where the person might be posting from, try searching that location and sorting by Places at the top right of the screen. This method will only work if the person’s account is public. If their account is private and you do not follow them, their photos will not be displayed under specific places.

steps.title: Press a specific location and look for a post from the person.
steps.content: Press a specific location and look for a post from the person. If you think they have posted recently, try filtering the results with the Recent tab. Otherwise, you will have to sift through the most popular posts for that location.

steps.title: Search for related hashtags.
steps.content: Search for related hashtags . Similarly to places, if you have some idea of how a person might tag their posts, look up that hashtag, then sort by Tags towards the top right of the page. As with the location-based method, this method will only work for public accounts (or private accounts you are already following).

steps.title: Tap a hashtag and look for a post from the person.
steps.content: Tap a hashtag and look for a post from the person. As above, try filtering your results with the Recent tab if it is likely the person posted recently. The more specific the hashtag, the better! Otherwise, you might have to sift through millions of posts.

steps.title: Open Instagram.
steps.content: Open Instagram. The Instagram app icon is a white camera on a multicolored background.

steps.title: Tap the magnifying glass.
steps.content: Tap the magnifying glass. You can find the magnifying glass icon at the bottom left of the screen.

steps.title: Search for a mutual friend’s account.
steps.content: Search for a mutual friend’s account. Using the search bar at the top of the page, find a mutual friend’s account through their name or username. Filter your search results using the Accounts tab at the top of the screen to exclude everything other than people’s profiles.

steps.title: Open their profile.
steps.content: Open their profile. Tap their profile from the list that appears to open it.

steps.title: Tap Followers or Following.
steps.content: Tap Followers or Following . Depending on the category you select, you will now see a list of individuals who follow your friend or are followed by your friend.

steps.title: Search for the desired person.
steps.content: Search for the desired person. Using the search bar at the top of the page, look for the desired account with the person’s name or possible usernames.

steps.title: Open Instagram.
steps.content: Open Instagram. The app icon for Instagram is a white camera on a multicolored background.

steps.title: Go to your profile.
steps.content: Go to your profile. Your profile can be opened by tapping your profile picture in the bottom-right corner of the screen. If you do not have a profile picture, you will instead see the silhouette of a person.

steps.title: Tap the three bars in the top right.
steps.content: Tap the three bars in the top right. A pop-up menu with a variety of options will appear from the bottom of your screen.

steps.title: Choose Settings.
steps.content: Choose Settings . Your Settings menu allows you to control different aspects of your account such as your notification settings, privacy, and more.

steps.title: Tap Follow and Invite Friends.
steps.content: Tap Follow and Invite Friends . This is the second option in the menu and is represented by a silhouette icon with a plus next to it.

steps.title: Press Follow Contacts.
steps.content: Press Follow Contacts . After tapping the button, a pop up will appear asking you to allow Instagram to access your contacts.

steps.title: Tap Allow Access.
steps.content: Tap Allow Access . Once you have granted Instagram permission to access your contacts list, you may be taken to a page in your Settings app where you need to enable contacts access for Instagram once more.

steps.title: Watch for Instagram’s account suggestions.
steps.content: Watch for Instagram’s account suggestions. Unfortunately, Instagram removed the Discover People feature that allowed you to scroll through a list of your contacts’ Instagram accounts, but after syncing your contacts , the app will still occasionally recommend related accounts. To see account suggestions related to specific people, go to their profile. If you are following their account or their account is public, tap the dropdown arrow next to Message to see related suggestions; otherwise, they will show up automatically. The app will occasionally send you a notification with an account recommendation, so keep an eye out for those in addition to in-app suggestions.
